Re: License #: CI250201372
Dear JAMES ALLAN PERLAKI:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
October 7, 2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker,
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is compliant with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not provided or requested.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not provided or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no concerns identified based on the review of the facility's 2025/2026 budget
and the agency's financial audit.
2

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
There were no areas of non-compliance during the renewal in 2024. During this
reporting period one youth went AWOL from the facility. At her last family session, the
youth became upset and ran away but was found and went home with her parents. The
agency reports they will continue to operate within the licensing guidelines.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed did not voice any concerns.
Youth were able to verbalize feeling safe and taken care of at the facility; no concerns
were noted by youth.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility is well maintained and has a welcoming environment. The facility updated their
upstairs shower/bath area. There are no concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
